intro: Cineraria palustris var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender cineraria, is a low-growing perennial herb native to wetland habitats in Europe. It features succulent, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. The plant produces small, inconspicuous blue or purple flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of ponds. Due to its delicate appearance and habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
